Oportunidade: Senior Data Engineer

Sobre a vaga
Senior Data Engineer 
Andela 
Location Requirement: Brazil, Canada, Egypt. 
 About Andela 
Andela exists to connect brilliance and opportunity. Since 2014, we have been dedicated to breaking down global barriers and accelerating the future of work for both technologists and organizations around the world. For technologists, Andela offers competitive long-term career opportunities with leading organizations, access to a global community of professionals, and educational opportunities with leading technology providers. 
 At Andela, we‚Äôre deeply passionate about creating long-lasting and transformative growth opportunities for all - and doing it in an E.P.I.C. way!  Our roles are typically filled at lightning speed, so if you‚Äôre considering applying, get your application in quickly! 
 Andela¬¥s Benefits: 
-- 100% payment in USD. 
 This is a fully remote opportunity for one of our esteemed clients.  
 About the role 
 Responsibilities: 
Developing pipelines to ingest data across multiple security products and delivering this data for use in Cisco‚Äôs XDR product. 
Using AWS services to deliver, process, and transform data 
Managing and monitoring application health and status across testing and production systems to ensure stability, high availability, and consistent delivery of data for the product 
Collaborating with other engineers to review code changes, communicate progress, and finalize system requirements 
Testing new features using unit tests, manual verification, and supporting end-to-end integration tests 
Building and maintaining data access layers to control access to sensitive data 
The role is a 70/30 split between Data Engineering and Data Architecture respectivel 
 Must have requirements: 
Data Engineering 
Python including libs e.g. pandas 
AWS services e.g., Lambda, Redshift, RDS, S3 (nice to have services include: CloudWatch, Aurora, Kinesis, Firehose, SQS, SNS, IAM) 
Terraform to help manage AWS serverless resources 
Strong Data Architecture experience 
Strong Communication & Stakeholder Management Skills 
Self-directed & Autonomous 
 Nice to have requirements: 
Project tracking management software (e.g., Jira, GitHub) 
CI/CD - control and continuous integration tools e.g., Jenkins, TeamCity, GitHub 
Performance monitoring & error tracking solutions 
Testing software code (e.g., manually testing functionality, writing automated unit tests, automating end-to-end tests) 
Support 
 Required skills 
Data Engineering (7 - 9 yrs) 
Python (4 - 6 yrs) 
AWS (Amazon Web Services) (4 - 6 yrs) 
Terraform (2 - 3 yrs) 
 Optional skills 
Jira (Atlassian) (4 - 6 yrs) 
Jenkins (4 - 6 yrs) 
 Must-Haves: Data Engineering (5+ years), Data Architecture (5+ years), Python (5+ years), AWS (5+ years), Terraform (2+ years) 
 Main job time zone: EST 
Time zone overlap requirements: Fully overlap hours with EST (9 am - 5 pm) 
Location Requirements: Brazil, Canada, Egypt. 
Working hours: Full-time dedication (8 hours/Day - 40 hours/week) 
 Offer 
Estimated Duration: 11-month-term contractor position (Renewable) 
Full-time dedication (40 hours/week)

Oportunidade: Data Scientist - Remote Work

Sobre a vaga
At BairesDev¬Æ, we've been leading the way in technology projects for over 15 years. We deliver cutting-edge solutions to giants like Google and the most innovative startups in Silicon Valley.

Our diverse 4,000+ team, composed of the world's Top 1% of tech talent, works remotely on roles that drive significant impact worldwide.

When you apply for this position, you're taking the first step in a process that goes beyond the ordinary. We aim to align your passions and skills with our vacancies, setting you on a path to exceptional career development and success.

Data Scientist at BairesDev

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Talent Acquisition team and use data science and machine learning techniques to develop, deliver, and maintain data products. This is an excellent opportunity to be a key member of our Data Science team and position yourself for unique career growth opportunities.

What You‚Äôll Do:

- Collaborate with product owners to develop data products and services.
- Tell stories with data in a compelling manner for business-oriented people.
- Design and serve machine-learning and deep-learning applications.
- Design experiments with solid research methods and proper statistical analysis.

What we are looking for:

- 4+ years of experience in Data Science and Machine Learning.
- Hands-on experience deploying machine learning models through REST APIs.
- Proficiency in Python or R oriented to Data Science.
- Experience with SQL databases for data analysis.
- Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git.
- Advanced level of English.

How we do make your work (and your life) easier:

- 100% remote work (from anywhere).
- Excellent compensation in USD or your local currency if preferred
- Hardware and software setup for you to work from home.
- Flexible hours: create your own schedule.
- Paid parental leaves, vacations, and national holidays.
- Innovative and multicultural work environment: collaborate and learn from the global Top 1% of talent.
- Supportive environment with mentorship, promotions, skill development, and diverse growth opportunities.

Apply now and become part of a global team where your unique talents can truly thrive!

Oportunidade: Senior Data Engineer

Sobre a vaga
Job Title: Senior Data Engineer
Location: Rio de Janeiro (Hybrid)


Overview:
We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in our data-driven journey, leading the development and maintenance of robust data infrastructure that supports risk and credit analysis, among other key areas. This position requires a deep understanding of data engineering practices, experience with Microsoft tools, as well as the ability to mentor and guide junior engineers.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Infrastructure Development: Development of foundational datasets for risk and credit analysis, including the collection and structuring of data from diverse sources.
Cloud Migration: Successfully manage the migration of data across various cloud vendors, including Microsoft Azure, ensuring data consistency and availability.
Data Quality Management: Design and implement a comprehensive data quality framework, ensuring the reliability of data across all pipelines.
Mentorship: Provide mentorship to the analysts, and promote best practices in coding, data management, and automation.
Automation and Efficiency: Automate data entry processes and other manual workflows, improving efficiency and saving valuable time.
Pipeline Management: Engineer and maintain data pipelines capable of processing large volumes of data daily, optimizing data flow and system performance.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders, to ensure data assets meet business requirements.

Skills & Qualifications:

Technical Expertise: Proficiency in Python, SQL, Spark, and ETL processes. Experience with Delta, Databricks, Docker, and Apache Airflow is highly valued.
Microsoft Tools: Strong experience with Microsoft Azure, Power BI, and SQL Server, with a proven track record of integrating and managing data within the Microsoft ecosystem.
Data Modeling: Expertise in data modeling and handling unstructured data.
Attention to Detail: Keen eye for detail, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data.
Workflow Management: Experience in managing data operations and workflow, with a focus on automation and dispute resolution.
Communication Skills: Fluent in English, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Experience Required:
Minimum of 5 years of experience in data engineering roles.
Prior experience working with Microsoft tools such as Azure, Power BI, and SQL Server.

Why Join Us?

Be part of an innovative quantification team.
Work in a dynamic environment where your contributions will directly impact the business.


Application Process:

If you are a Senior Data Engineer looking to make a significant impact and grow your career in a forward-thinking company, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join our team!
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Oportunidade: Data Scientist - Remote Work

Sobre a vaga
At BairesDev¬Æ, we've been leading the way in technology projects for over 15 years. We deliver cutting-edge solutions to giants like Google and the most innovative startups in Silicon Valley.

Our diverse 4,000+ team, composed of the world's Top 1% of tech talent, works remotely on roles that drive significant impact worldwide.

When you apply for this position, you're taking the first step in a process that goes beyond the ordinary. We aim to align your passions and skills with our vacancies, setting you on a path to exceptional career development and success.

Data Scientist at BairesDev

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Talent Acquisition team and use data science and machine learning techniques to develop, deliver, and maintain data products. This is an excellent opportunity to be a key member of our Data Science team and position yourself for unique career growth opportunities.

What You‚Äôll Do:

- Collaborate with product owners to develop data products and services.
- Tell stories with data in a compelling manner for business-oriented people.
- Design and serve machine-learning and deep-learning applications.
- Design experiments with solid research methods and proper statistical analysis.

What we are looking for:

- 4+ years of experience in Data Science and Machine Learning.
- Hands-on experience deploying machine learning models through REST APIs.
- Proficiency in Python or R oriented to Data Science.
- Experience with SQL databases for data analysis.
- Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git.
- Advanced level of English.

How we do make your work (and your life) easier:

- 100% remote work (from anywhere).
- Excellent compensation in USD or your local currency if preferred
- Hardware and software setup for you to work from home.
- Flexible hours: create your own schedule.
- Paid parental leaves, vacations, and national holidays.
- Innovative and multicultural work environment: collaborate and learn from the global Top 1% of talent.

Oportunidade: Senior Full Stack Engineer

Sobre a vaga
Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. As a consulting company, we often face the challenge of creating an engineering team in a matter of a week or two. To do that, we have created a secondary support business that runs a talent network and provides staffing services.

Our client is a healthcare-focused company that builds software designed to make the process of expediting healthcare plans and approving procedures in record time so that both patients and doctors can focus on what's more important - health.


The position

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a high-caliber software engineering team that is growing quickly. You will build impactful healthcare technology on a modern technology stack, by excelling in building new functionalities that support our client's teams to evolve product offerings and clinical intelligence.
It's a fully remote (of course!), full-time position for candidates in Latin America who can work on USA Eastern Time office hours (check what time it is in New York, for instance, and compare to your own to see what's the difference).
Responsibilities
Work on fast-paced, collaborative, agile teams to build and enhance a growing software platform together
Responsible for end-to-end feature releases and platform enhancements
Actively support the technical design process, bringing your expertise and analysis to help make data-driven decisions
Contribute heavily to feature design, development, testing, and delivery of our client's cloud platform and web applications
Support all parts of our client's platform from the database to the frontend
Continuously discover, understand, and implement new technologies & services to maximize development efficiency
Contribute to a culture committed to testing, quality, and attention to detail by supporting best practices such as writing and maintaining comprehensive test coverage
Actively participate in ensuring our client maintains a disciplined approach to healthcare security
Foster a community of mentorship for junior engineers on your team
 
Your background & requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
Experience working on software development teams, building and deploying full-stack web applications
Passionate about building quality products and want to own product development end-to-end, with excellent design and development standards
Collaborate closely with teammates in product and design to build applications providing healthcare practitioners with the highest quality user experience
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD
Team player, interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
A minimum of 7 full years of experience in the software development lifecycle
Experience with data pipelines or applications using Java, or Groovy, or Kotlin
Experience building applications using React (mandatory) and TypeScript (nice to have)
Hands-on experience leveraging test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest, Mocha, JUnit, or Cucumber
Hands-on experience building applications on either SQL or NoSQL technologies
 If you have experience with NoSQL technologies, then we would be looking for hands-on in-depth experience building and maintaining services using either MongoDB or Elasticsearch or Kafka
If you have experience with SQL technologies, we need you to have in-depth experience building and maintaining services with SQL databases.
You can start as soon as possible
You are located in Latin America
You can work EST (Eastern Time) office hours


Nice to haves

Prior experience in healthcare and life sciences
Experience with Amazon Athena
Familiarity with healthcare interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR)
Experience with integration engines (like Mirth Connect, Mulesoft, etc.) for healthcare data exchange and transformation
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD (the team uses GitHub Actions)


Our recruitment process
Recruiter interview (30 min)
Technical interview (45 min)
Take-home coding exam (30 to 45 minutes, online, timed)
(Client) Hiring Manager interview (30 min)
(Client) Design & development competency check interview (about 45 minutes)
(Client) Final interview (30 min)


We strive to move efficiently from step to step so that the recruitment process can be as fast as possible.

Oportunidade: Senior Full Stack Engineer

Sobre a vaga
Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. As a consulting company, we often face the challenge of creating an engineering team in a matter of a week or two. To do that, we have created a secondary support business that runs a talent network and provides staffing services.

Our client is a healthcare-focused company that builds software designed to make the process of expediting healthcare plans and approving procedures in record time so that both patients and doctors can focus on what's more important - health.


The position

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a high-caliber software engineering team that is growing quickly. You will build impactful healthcare technology on a modern technology stack, by excelling in building new functionalities that support our client's teams to evolve product offerings and clinical intelligence.
It's a fully remote (of course!), full-time position for candidates in Latin America who can work on USA Eastern Time office hours (check what time it is in New York, for instance, and compare to your own to see what's the difference).
Responsibilities
Work on fast-paced, collaborative, agile teams to build and enhance a growing software platform together
Responsible for end-to-end feature releases and platform enhancements
Actively support the technical design process, bringing your expertise and analysis to help make data-driven decisions
Contribute heavily to feature design, development, testing, and delivery of our client's cloud platform and web applications
Support all parts of our client's platform from the database to the frontend
Continuously discover, understand, and implement new technologies & services to maximize development efficiency
Contribute to a culture committed to testing, quality, and attention to detail by supporting best practices such as writing and maintaining comprehensive test coverage
Actively participate in ensuring our client maintains a disciplined approach to healthcare security
Foster a community of mentorship for junior engineers on your team
 
Your background & requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
Experience working on software development teams, building and deploying full-stack web applications
Passionate about building quality products and want to own product development end-to-end, with excellent design and development standards
Collaborate closely with teammates in product and design to build applications providing healthcare practitioners with the highest quality user experience
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD
Team player, interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
A minimum of 7 full years of experience in the software development lifecycle
Experience with data pipelines or applications using Java, or Groovy, or Kotlin
Experience building applications using React (mandatory) and TypeScript (nice to have)
Hands-on experience leveraging test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest, Mocha, JUnit, or Cucumber
Hands-on experience building applications on either SQL or NoSQL technologies
 If you have experience with NoSQL technologies, then we would be looking for hands-on in-depth experience building and maintaining services using either MongoDB or Elasticsearch or Kafka
If you have experience with SQL technologies, we need you to have in-depth experience building and maintaining services with SQL databases.
You can start as soon as possible
You are located in Latin America
You can work EST (Eastern Time) office hours


Nice to haves

Prior experience in healthcare and life sciences
Experience with Amazon Athena
Familiarity with healthcare interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR)
Experience with integration engines (like Mirth Connect, Mulesoft, etc.) for healthcare data exchange and transformation
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD (the team uses GitHub Actions)


Our recruitment process
Recruiter interview (30 min)
Technical interview (45 min)
Take-home coding exam (30 to 45 minutes, online, timed)
(Client) Hiring Manager interview (30 min)
(Client) Design & development competency check interview (about 45 minutes)
(Client) Final interview (30 min)


We strive to move efficiently from step to step so that the recruitment process can be as fast as possible.
 
What we offer
Totally remote, full-time (40h/week)
Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time office hours
Long-term, no end date independent contractor agreement
Payment in USD, biweekly or monthly - your choice
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. Collaborate closely with teammates in product and design to build applications providing healthcare practitioners with the highest quality user experience
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD
Team player, interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
A minimum of 7 full years of experience in the software development lifecycle
Experience with data pipelines or applications using Java or Groovy or Kotlin
Experience building applications using React (mandatory) and TypeScript (nice-to-have)
Hands-on experience leveraging test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest, Mocha, JUnit, or Cucumber
Hands-on experience building applications on NoSQL technologies
Hands-on in-depth experience building and maintaining services using either MongoDB or Elasticsearch or Kafka

Recruiter interview (30 min)
Technical interview (45 min)
Take-home coding exam (30 to 45 minutes, online, timed)
Hiring Manager (client) interview (30 min)
Design & development competency check interview (client) (about 45 minutes)
Final (client) interview (30 min)
 
We strive to move efficiently from step to step so that the recruitment process can be as fast as possible.

 What we offer

Totally remote, full-time (40h/week)
Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time office hours
Long-term, no end date independent contractor agreement
Payment in USD, biweekly or monthly - your choice

Oportunidade: Analytics Principal Engineer

Sobre a vaga
We are Kaizen Gaming

Kaizen Gaming is the leading GameTech company in Greece and one of the fastest-growing in the world, operating in 13 markets with 2 brands, Betano & Stoiximan. We always aim to leverage cutting-edge technology, providing the best experience to our millions of customers who trust us for their entertainment. We are a diverse team of more than 2.200 Kaizeners, from 40+ nationalities spreading across 3 continents. Our #oneteam is proud to be among the Best Workplaces in Europe and certified Great Place to Work across our offices. Here, there‚Äôll be no average day for you. Ready to press play on potential?

Let's start with the role

We‚Äôre looking for an Analytics Principal Engineer to join our Analytics teams. You will help teams devise elegant and performant solutions to real business problems, guide them in designing and implementing these solutions in code, teach coding, testing, and performance analysis techniques, while also carrying out code reviews. You will frequently attend teams' scrum events (especially refinements) and help teams' product owners better understand of the technical challenges involved. Production problems are usually escalated to the Principal Engineer for triaging before landing in a team's backlog. Principal Engineers should also stay up to date on the latest technologies and drive their adoption. Our Analytics team(s) has expertise in several fields including, but not limited to, Databricks,/ Delta Lake,/ SQL Server,/ Azure Data Warehouse, SSRS, and SSIS.

As an Analytics Principal Engineer you will:
Lead team enablement initiatives;
Orchestrate plans by motivating other team members and collaborating closely to achieve them;
Break efforts down and guide the reporting engineers through gaps to lead them to sound technical solutions;
Share technical expertise and knowledge sharing. Present practices, innovations, and inventions inside and outside of the organization;
Partner with management to find new potential talent;
Mentor engineers to take them to the next level of their careers;
Set up cross-organization engineering best practice standards and guidelines. Create a culture where contribution patterns and quality are paramount. Partner closely with teams to implement these standards.

What you‚Äôll bring

Hands-on experience in writing complex, highly optimized SQL code for data manipulation and reporting;
Solid experience in ETL/ELT, Data Modeling, Data Warehouse Architecture and Reporting tools;
Knowledge of Data Governance;
Good people skills;
Team player, analytical thinker and problem solver, with ability to self-organize;
Fast learner - you will need to get up to speed on business, people and teams, infrastructure and the technologies used, as quickly as possible.

Nice to have

A bachelor's degree in a quantitative/technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering) or equivalent industry experience;
Experience in the Microsoft BI stack (SQL Server, SSRS, SSAS);
Experience with Azure Data platforms such as Synapse Analytics, Data Lake, Databricks;
Experience in programming languages preferable in Python or Scala;
Exposure to CI/CD;
Exposure to an Agile team-working environment.

Kaizen Gaming Perks
üèÉ A buddy will support you with your onboarding.
üí∏ Competitive salary package and bonus scheme
üìö Unlimited access to Udemy & continuous training for all your learning and development needs
üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Health and life insurance for you and your family
üí∞ Monthly allowance for lunch & commuting expenses
‚≠êClear career paths and a developmental 360¬∞ feedback framework

Oportunidade: Senior Full Stack Engineer

Sobre a vaga
Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. As a consulting company, we often face the challenge of creating an engineering team in a matter of a week or two. To do that, we have created a secondary support business that runs a talent network and provides staffing services.

Our client is a healthcare-focused company that builds software designed to make the process of expediting healthcare plans and approving procedures in record time so that both patients and doctors can focus on what's more important - health.


The position

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a high-caliber software engineering team that is growing quickly. You will build impactful healthcare technology on a modern technology stack, by excelling in building new functionalities that support our client's teams to evolve product offerings and clinical intelligence.
It's a fully remote (of course!), full-time position for candidates in Latin America who can work on USA Eastern Time office hours (check what time it is in New York, for instance, and compare to your own to see what's the difference).


Responsibilities

Work on fast-paced, collaborative, agile teams to build and enhance a growing software platform together
Responsible for end-to-end feature releases and platform enhancements
Actively support the technical design process, bringing your expertise and analysis to help make data-driven decisions
Contribute heavily to feature design, development, testing, and delivery of our client's cloud platform and web applications
Support all parts of our client's platform from the database to the frontend
Continuously discover, understand, and implement new technologies & services to maximize development efficiency
Contribute to a culture committed to testing, quality, and attention to detail by supporting best practices such as writing and maintaining comprehensive test coverage
Actively participate in ensuring our client maintains a disciplined approach to healthcare security
Foster a community of mentorship for junior engineers on your team
 
Your background & requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
Experience working on software development teams, building and deploying full-stack web applications
Passionate about building quality products and want to own product development end-to-end, with excellent design and development standards
Collaborate closely with teammates in product and design to build applications providing healthcare practitioners with the highest quality user experience
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD
Team player, interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
A minimum of 7 full years of experience in the software development lifecycle
Experience with data pipelines or applications using Java, or Groovy, or Kotlin
Experience building applications using React (mandatory) and TypeScript (nice to have)
Hands-on experience leveraging test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest, Mocha, JUnit, or Cucumber
Hands-on experience building applications on either SQL or NoSQL technologies
 If you have experience with NoSQL technologies, then we would be looking for hands-on in-depth experience building and maintaining services using either MongoDB or Elasticsearch or Kafka
If you have experience with SQL technologies, we need you to have in-depth experience building and maintaining services with SQL databases.
You can start as soon as possible
You are located in Latin America
You can work EST (Eastern Time) office hours


Nice to haves

Prior experience in healthcare and life sciences
Experience with Amazon Athena
Familiarity with healthcare interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR)
Experience with integration engines (like Mirth Connect, Mulesoft, etc.) for healthcare data exchange and transformation
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD (the team uses GitHub Actions)


Our recruitment process

Recruiter interview (30 min)
Technical interview (45 min)
Take-home coding exam (30 to 45 minutes, online, timed)
(Client) Hiring Manager interview (30 min)
(Client) Design & development competency check interview (about 45 minutes)
(Client) Final interview (30 min)


We strive to move efficiently from step to step so that the recruitment process can be as fast as possible.
 
What we offer

Totally remote, full-time (40h/week)
Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time office hours
Long-term, no end date independent contractor agreement
Payment in USD, biweekly or monthly - your choice
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sobre a vaga
Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. As a consulting company, we often face the challenge of creating an engineering team in a matter of a week or two. Oportunidade: Data Engineer

Sobre a vaga
If you are looking for a meaningful job where people work and act with passion, rethink the existing and always strive to find the best solution - you have come to the right place. We develop future technologies to conquer supply chain complexity, together.

Overview

K√∂rber Supply Chain is a global provider of a unique blend of supply chain management software solutions. As a high-growth international corporation, K√∂rber Supply Chain serves the evolving and increasingly complex requirements of supply chain operations of all sizes. Through a culture of innovation, K√∂rber Supply Chain strikes the perfect balance amongst client satisfaction, employee fulfillment, and shareholder value through our accelerated services. Joining the K√∂rber Supply Chain team means joining a network of diverse individuals all committed to helping our clients achieve improved productivity and customer satisfaction.

The role is part of a strategic growing initiative to support the business with the integration of innovative products and features utilizing Artificial Intelligence, Operations Research, Advanced Analytics and other data oriented fields.

We are looking for an experienced and ambitious Data Developer with Python & SQL/NoSQL skills to join our growing global and distributed Data Platform team. As a tech savvy software craftsman, you must have a deep understanding of coding principles, understand object-oriented programming and appreciate the agile development way of working. All developers are encouraged to consistently assist in innovation of the software development in terms of agility, DevOps and modern development technologies.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines using Python and open-source tools and frameworks.
Parse and process spreadsheets for data mappings from a product data model to a unified common data model.
Write and optimize Spark jobs to aggregate and transform large datasets.
Implement ETL processes to integrate data from various sources into our data warehouse.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other team members to understand data needs and deliver high-quality data solutions.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security throughout the data lifecycle.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline performance and reliability issues.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data engineering and big data technologies.

Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience (atleast 3 years) as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Experience with Data Lake / Delta Lake / Lakehouse technologies
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with open-source data processing frameworks.
Hands-on experience with Apache Spark and other big data technologies.
Experience with ETL processes and tools such as Apache Airflow, Luigi, or similar.
Familiarity with data modeling and data mapping techniques.
Experience working with various data formats (CSV, JSON, Parquet, etc.) and databases (SQL and NoSQL).
Familiarity with data security, regional segregation and large data sets
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Knowledge of supply chain and how data engineering principles apply to various areas in the domain is an advantage.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, GCP or OCI.
Experience with cloud services for data engineering for example Azure Data Factory, Data Bricks, etc.
Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes.
Knowledge of widely known data platforms (like Snowflake) and how data engineering principles are applied and managed in those data platforms.

What We Offer

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies in a dynamic and innovative environment.
Collaborative and inclusive company culture.
Professional development opportunities.
Numerous further training opportunities, including in our ACADEMY.

Please submit your resume in English. 

If a candidate from Brazil is hired, the job title will be registered as "Developer" in the CLT (Brazilian labor card).

Help enable those who move goods to do good by contributing your skills and individual viewpoints in a highly collaborative, caring team environment.

K√∂rber Supply Chain Software better enables those who move goods to do good when we prioritize diversity, equity, and inclusion. It‚Äôs better for our people, better for our business, and better for the world. That‚Äôs why at K√∂rber we cultivate and celebrate our colleagues‚Äô experiences and perspectives, whether they look, think, move, believe, or love differently than us. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment and pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply and all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to gender and identity, age, race, religion, ethnicity, ancestry, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or veteran status.

Oportunidade: Senior Software Engineer, Developer Experience

Sobre a vaga
The Company You‚Äôll Join

Carta is a platform that helps people manage equity, build businesses, and invest in the companies of tomorrow. Our mission is to unlock the power of equity ownership for more people in more places.

Carta is trusted by more than 40,000 companies and over two million people in nearly 160 countries to manage cap tables, compensation, and valuations. Carta also supports nearly 7,000 funds and SPVs, and represents nearly $130B in assets under administration. Carta's tender offer solutions have returned $14B to shareholders in secondary transactions. Today, Carta‚Äôs platform manages nearly three trillion dollars in equity globally.

For more information about our offices and culture, check out our Carta careers page.

The Problems You'll Solve

At Carta, Our Employees Set Out On a Mission To Unlock The Power Of Equity Ownership For More People In More Places. We Believe That The Problems We Solve Today Unlock The Opportunities Of Tomorrow. As a Senior Software Engineer, You‚Äôll Work To

Here are some problems we need you to help us solve:

Carta‚Äôs developers work in distinct codebases that have their own architecture and logic: how do we build impactful solutions across these repos while maintaining consistency and efficiency?
If we think about the software development lifecycle as a continuous transaction, where are the optimal starting points to introduce standardized processes and supported workflows to reduce complexity and friction in development?
How can we proactively remove customer toil ahead of it being a blocker for developers? 

In This Role You Will

Architect, design and code highly available, secure, and scalable managed solutions like PaaS and IaaS
Drive the implementation of continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, automating build, test, and deployment processes to accelerate software delivery 
Direct developers on how to leverage monitoring, alerting, and logging of the Platform to improve observability
Continuously evaluate and improve the developer experience by gathering feedback, measuring key metrics, and iterating on solutions to address emerging needs and challenges.
Mentor and grow junior software engineers

The Team You'll Work With

You will join our Developer Experience (DevEx) team of software engineers and infrastructure gurus within our Platform organization. Our North Star is to remove friction and toil during the software development lifecycle for our internal developers so that they can do the best work of their career.

We deliver an end-to-end developer experience that is customer-focused, data-driven, and predictable. We do this by increasing development velocity through automation, eliminating friction via paved roads, providing customized recommendations across the organization, and allowing product engineers to specify intent declaratively, decoupled from implementation details.

We work backwards from our customer‚Äôs needs and iterate quickly based on their feedback. Sitting at the nexus between our developers and our backend systems, DevEx is in a unique position to collect customer feedback and help shape strategy and direction for Platform teams as a whole.

About You

At Carta, you‚Äôre not just an employee. You‚Äôre a builder who is creating the infrastructure and tooling that accelerates innovation and empowers more ownership. Cartans are helpful, relentless, unconventional and kind; representing Carta‚Äôs Identity Traits. They work collaboratively and cross functionally to challenge the status quo; working towards a common goal of creating more owners in the private markets.

4+ years of relevant industry experience recommended
Years of experience - refer to Carta‚Äôs global leveling guidelines
Strong engineering practices (e.g. coding, unit testing, code reviews, design documentation)
Customer-centric. You‚Äôll be working to simplify solutions and communicate them with your internal stakeholders regularly
Experience developing backend services
Experience with Python or Java
Experience leading, growing and mentoring other engineers

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, please connect with the recruiter via email. As a company, we value fairness, helpfulness, transparency, leadership and build our teams around these values. Check out our careers page to get to know us better as you think about your next step at Carta.

Important Security Notice for Candidates

Our company has been targeted by individuals creating fake domains similar to ours to scam prospects and candidates. Please note that all official communications from us will come from an @carta.com domain. Be cautious of any requests for sensitive information or payments outside of our official channels. For more information about this type of scam, please review the guidelines provided by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC). If you encounter any suspicious activity, please report it immediately to recruiting-systems@carta.com.

Awards and Acknowledgements

Companies and funds like Tribe and Pipe build their businesses on Carta. The company has been included on the Forbes World‚Äôs Best Cloud Companies, Fast Company's Most Innovative list, and Inc.‚Äôs Fastest-Growing Private Companies. We‚Äôve also been recognized as a 2023 Built In Best Place to Work in the U.S., a Muse VIBE Award winner in the Vacation and Time Off category and certified as a Great Place to Work.

Interested in data privacy? Check out our policies on Privacy and CA Candidate Privacy.

Sobre a vaga
Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. Contribute to a culture committed to testing, quality, and attention to detail by supporting best practices such as writing and maintaining comprehensive test coverage
Actively participate in ensuring our client maintains a disciplined approach to healthcare security

Collaborate closely with teammates in product and design to build applications providing healthcare practitioners with the highest quality user experience
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD
Team player, interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
A minimum of 7 full years of experience in the software development lifecycle
Experience with data pipelines or applications using Java or Groovy or Kotlin
Experience building applications using React (mandatory) and TypeScript (nice-to-have)
Hands-on experience leveraging test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest, Mocha, JUnit, or Cucumber

Oportunidade: Senior Full Stack Engineer

Sobre a vaga
Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. As a consulting company, we often face the challenge of creating an engineering team in a matter of a week or two. To do that, we have created a secondary support business that runs a talent network and provides staffing services.

Our client is a healthcare-focused company that builds software designed to make the process of expediting healthcare plans and approving procedures in record time so that both patients and doctors can focus on what's more important - health.


The position

You will build impactful healthcare technology on a modern technology stack, by excelling in building new functionalities that support our client's teams to evolve product offerings and clinical intelligence.
It's a fully remote (of course!), full-time position for candidates either in Latin America, Africa, or Eastern Europe who can work on USA Eastern Time office hours (check what time it is in New York, for instance, and compare to your own to see what's the difference).

Work on fast-paced, collaborative, agile teams to build and enhance a growing software platform together
Responsible for end-to-end feature releases and platform enhancements
Actively support the technical design process, bringing your expertise and analysis to help make data-driven decisions
Contribute heavily to feature design, development, testing, and delivery of our client's cloud platform and web applications

Contribute to a culture committed to testing, quality, and attention to detail by supporting best practices such as writing and maintaining comprehensive test coverage
Actively participate in ensuring our client maintains a disciplined approach to healthcare security
Foster a community of mentorship for junior engineers on your team
 
Your background & requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
Experience working on software development teams, building and deploying full-stack web applications
Passionate about building quality products and want to own product development end-to-end, with excellent design and development standards
Collaborate closely with teammates in product and design to build applications providing healthcare practitioners with the highest quality user experience
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD
Team player, interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
A minimum of 7 full years of experience in the software development lifecycle
Experience with data pipelines or applications using Java or Groovy or Kotlin
Experience building applications using React (mandatory) and TypeScript (nice-to-have)
Hands-on experience leveraging test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest, Mocha, JUnit, or Cucumber
Hands-on experience building applications on NoSQL technologies
Hands-on in-depth experience building and maintaining services using either MongoDB or Elasticsearch or Kafka
You can start as soon as possible, ideally immediately
You are located in either Latin America, Africa, or Eastern Europe
You can work EST (Eastern Time) office hours


Nice to haves

Prior experience in healthcare and life sciences
Familiarity with healthcare interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR)
Experience with integration engines (like Mirth Connect, Mulesoft, etc.) for healthcare data exchange and transformation
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD (the team uses GitHub Actions)


Our recruitment process

Recruiter interview (30 min)
Technical interview (45 min)
Take-home coding exam (30 to 45 minutes, online, timed)
Hiring Manager (client) interview (30 min)
Design & development competency check interview (client) (about 45 minutes)
Final (client) interview (30 min)
 
We strive to move efficiently from step to step so that the recruitment process can be as fast as possible.

 What we offer

Totally remote, full-time (40h/week)
Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time office hours
Long-term, no end date independent contractor agreement
Payment in USD, biweekly or monthly - your choice

Oportunidade: Senior Full Stack Engineer

Sobre a vaga
Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. As a consulting company, we often face the challenge of creating an engineering team in a matter of a week or two. To do that, we have created a secondary support business that runs a talent network and provides staffing services.

Our client is a healthcare-focused company that builds software designed to make the process of expediting healthcare plans and approving procedures in record time so that both patients and doctors can focus on what's more important - health.


The position

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a high-caliber software engineering team that is growing quickly. You will build impactful healthcare technology on a modern technology stack, by excelling in building new functionalities that support our client's teams to evolve product offerings and clinical intelligence.
It's a fully remote (of course!), full-time position for candidates in Latin America who can work on USA Eastern Time office hours (check what time it is in New York, for instance, and compare to your own to see what's the difference).
Responsibilities
Work on fast-paced, collaborative, agile teams to build and enhance a growing software platform together
Responsible for end-to-end feature releases and platform enhancements
Actively support the technical design process, bringing your expertise and analysis to help make data-driven decisions
Contribute heavily to feature design, development, testing, and delivery of our client's cloud platform and web applications
Support all parts of our client's platform from the database to the frontend
Continuously discover, understand, and implement new technologies & services to maximize development efficiency
Contribute to a culture committed to testing, quality, and attention to detail by supporting best practices such as writing and maintaining comprehensive test coverage
Actively participate in ensuring our client maintains a disciplined approach to healthcare security
Foster a community of mentorship for junior engineers on your team
 
Your background & requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
Experience working on software development teams, building and deploying full-stack web applications
Passionate about building quality products and want to own product development end-to-end, with excellent design and development standards
Collaborate closely with teammates in product and design to build applications providing healthcare practitioners with the highest quality user experience
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD
Team player, interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
A minimum of 7 full years of experience in the software development lifecycle
Experience with data pipelines or applications using Java, or Groovy, or Kotlin
Experience building applications using React (mandatory) and TypeScript (nice to have)
Hands-on experience leveraging test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest, Mocha, JUnit, or Cucumber
Hands-on experience building applications on either SQL or NoSQL technologies
 If you have experience with NoSQL technologies, then we would be looking for hands-on in-depth experience building and maintaining services using either MongoDB or Elasticsearch or Kafka
If you have experience with SQL technologies, we need you to have in-depth experience building and maintaining services with SQL databases.
You can start as soon as possible
You are located in Latin America
You can work EST (Eastern Time) office hours


Nice to haves

Prior experience in healthcare and life sciences
Experience with Amazon Athena
Familiarity with healthcare interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR)
Experience with integration engines (like Mirth Connect, Mulesoft, etc.) for healthcare data exchange and transformation
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD (the team uses GitHub Actions)


Our recruitment process
Recruiter interview (30 min)
Technical interview (45 min)
Take-home coding exam (30 to 45 minutes, online, timed)
(Client) Hiring Manager interview (30 min)
(Client) Design & development competency check interview (about 45 minutes)
(Client) Final interview (30 min)


We strive to move efficiently from step to step so that the recruitment process can be as fast as possible.
 
What we offer
Totally remote, full-time (40h/week)
Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time office hours
Long-term, no end date independent contractor agreement
Payment in USD, biweekly or monthly - your choice

Oportunidade: Senior Backend Engineer in Sustainable Agtech & AI @ Adaviv -an MIT Spinoff

Sobre a vaga
Where would you work?
Adaviv, spun off from MIT, offers the world's first farmer-centric AI platform for greenhouse and controlled farms. Our AI mentor empowers farm managers and upskills workers, providing real-time insights to enhance productivity, retention, and operational efficiency. Based at Greentown Labs, Somerville, MA, Adaviv serves leading greenhouse and indoor farms globally. We boost yields by up to 31% and cut losses by 45%, saving managers hours each week for critical decisions like worker feedback, treatment optimization, and crop planning. We're growing and seeking passionate, mission-driven individuals with a growth mindset to join our team.

What would you be doing?
As a Senior Backend Application Engineer at Adaviv, you will be working with our engineering team as well as Product Lead, CTO, Frontend engineers and our UI/UX designers to advance our CI/CD pipeline and implement new data pipelines and APIs for our beta and production-level mobile and web apps towards supporting a growing pool of clients across the Americas and building game-changing products for sustainable Agriculture. You will work on building, maintaining and improving our cloud tech stack. You will also work with the software team to create and maintain an optimized data schema for these new features using google cloud and AWS infrastructure.

You‚Äôll have the opportunity to make a big impact on both the company and our customers. We bring design-to-value thinking to all dimensions of our product development and believe in designing highly intuitive experiences that make our end customer‚Äôs job easier. You'll be in charge of quickly improving performance and developing high-impact features, while also keeping one eye on scalability and security of backend services as we grow. At Adaviv, we value continuous learning and adaptability, encouraging you to explore new technologies and methodologies in our fast-paced environment.

We thrive on cross-functional collaboration and communication, with our engineers working closely with product leads, designers, and front-end developers to deliver seamless solutions. For example, we involve engineers in customer workshops and are highly collaborative as we design and refine features like our AI-powered insight delivery.

Who are we looking for?
We are seeking a passionate individual with 3+ years of engineering experience in industrial production settings, a proven track record of consistently achieving engineering milestones and KPIs and a can-do-will-do mindset to build and grow with our company at a fast, but rewarding pace. One of your super powers is your ability to quickly turn business requirements into high quality implementations of backend application services that support our mobile and web-based apps, while collaborating and communicating effectively with our front-end engineers and UI/UX designer. It would be necessary for this role to have excellent communication skills.

Agile software development is fundamental to your work and you possess a solid toolset for API and data pipeline/analytics development. You keep the end-user front of mind and will help us cultivate empathy for our customers and for fellow team members.

Degree Requirement:

B.Sc or M.Sc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a relevant field (not a must but strongly preferred).

Required Skills and Qualifications:

5+ years experience in back-end/API software development in an industrial setting (production level contribution).
5+ years industry experience developing, deploying, and maintaining APIs, relational databases and data pipelines is a must.
Expertise in in one of the programming languages used to develop cloud tech stack for backend services, savvy in useful libraries, tools, platforms, and development environments that are widely used.
Experience building and deploying APIs that are used commercially.
Expertise in agile and continuous software development.
Strong background in Test-Driven Development and ability to independently carry out all phases of a software development process.
Demonstrated aptitude in current state-of-the-art developments of cloud applications and rapid development frameworks.

Preferred but not Required Skills:

Fluency in Python, Typescript
Dual degrees in relevant fields of CS, Software Engineering, Design, math etc.
Experience building software products for traditional industries like agriculture, manufacturing, supply chain, energy or adjacent fields.
Familiarity with User-Centric Design (UI/UX theory) and first-hand experience surveying customer feedback.
Full-stack development experience (Python, AWS ecosystem - data orchestration tools)
Fundamental knowledge of data engineering and algorithm principles

Additional Details:

This role requires full-time engagement.
Remote or hybrid remote-in-person flexible.
Annual salary. We offer an opportunity for equity ownership, with a clear vesting schedule and the potential for significant growth as the company scales.

Final Words. 
Principles of sustainability are at our core. We value integrity, excellence, hard work, respect, and collaboration. You'll operate as a member of a fun, diverse team (6 nationalities!) and work both independently and collaboratively. We promote and foster diversity of people and ideas, while cultivating empathy for our customers and team members.

We are committed to your professional growth, offering access to conferences, workshops, and continued education support. Adaviv also provides flexible remote or hybrid work options to help you balance your professional and personal life effectively.

Want to be a part of our team? If Adaviv sounds like the type of company you‚Äôd like to be a part of and want to help us change how we grow food and medicines for the better, then please apply!

Sobre a vaga
Building with the latest tools, our Machine Learning teams launch for Silicon Valley startups and Life Science giants alike.

Join Loka to work remotely, ship projects you‚Äôre proud of and enjoy every other Friday off.

The Role
Understand business objectives and develop models that help achieve them, plus metrics to track their progress.
Design and implement complex ML systems using classical ML, DL and Foundation Models and following best practices.
Lead client communications by gathering requirements, managing expectations and communicating deliverables.
Wrangle, explore and visualize data with a careful eye for issues that require data cleaning as well as differences in data distribution that may affect performance after deployment.
Analyze model errors; design strategies to overcome them.
Deploy, maintain and upgrade ML models and pipelines.
Follow Loka‚Äôs career track for growth by demonstrating technical excellence, innovation, autonomy, ownership, communication and teamwork.

The Benefits
Every other Friday off (26 extra days off a year!)
LokaLabs incubator
Explore and Relocation programs (three months work abroad or full international relo)
Remote and flexible
Paid sick days and local holidays
Fitness subscription

The Required Hard Skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related
Proficient in English
Experience with Python, ML libraries and AI/ML frameworks (PyTorch, HuggingFace, TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn, Spark etc.)
Strong understanding of statistical, ML and deep learning algorithms (candidates with NLP experience preferred)
Experience building GenAI solutions including prompt engineering (e.g: Langchain), fine-tuning and serving LLMs, search and embeddings, etc.
Experience with MLOps, preferably in AWS (e.g: Sagemaker), as well as standards tools (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience visualizing and manipulating big datasets
Client-facing experience
Clean criminal record

Autonomy and positivity‚ÄîWe‚Äôre a fully remote, globally distributed team
Teamwork‚ÄîEnjoy a collaborative approach
Adaptability‚ÄîOperate with a startup mindset and move at a startup pace

Oportunidade: Software Engineering Lead, Brazil - X Delivery

Sobre a vaga
Locations: S√£o Paulo | Rio de Janeiro

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

As a part of BCG's X Delivery team, you will play a pivotal role in bridging technology and strategy. You will collaborate with premier consulting teams around the world, applying your software development expertise across a variety of ambitious and ground-breaking international projects. You will be instrumental in advancing BCG's Consulting and BCG X teams by providing critical software development insights and speeding up project execution. As a Lead Software Engineer, you will be at the heart of action, from gathering initial requirements to designing, developing, and delivering high-quality software solutions that address our client's unique challenges. With a deep understanding of the latest tools and processes, you'll craft high-quality, efficient tech solutions. Your projects will span the spectrum, from swiftly driven Proof of Concepts and Minimum Viable Products to managing long-term, enterprise-grade software developments that are integral to our project successes. Each project offers a unique opportunity to showcase your skills and make a significant impact within BCG and its esteemed clientele.

What You'll Bring

We are seeking a technologically adept individual who brings strong experience and diverse skills to our dynamic team. This role is an outstanding opportunity for someone who is passionate about software development and eager to make an impact in a fast-paced, innovative environment.

Technical Skills - Knowledge and Experience with:

Strong coding skills and proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, Kotlin, Node.js, Go, Ruby, Rust, C#, etc. 
Experience in web technologies, including proficiency in Typescript and modern JavaScript frameworks like React, Next.js, and Angular. 
Capability in building APIs and services using REST or GraphQL. 
Practical knowledge of cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP). 
Experience with relational and NoSQL databases. 

Additional Skills:

Knowledge of Spark or related systems (Hadoop, Pig, Hive). 
Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes). 
Familiarity with CI/CD tools (CircleCI, Jenkins). 
Exposure to emerging technologies like AR/VR, IoT, AI, and Blockchain. 
Knowledge in mobile development with Objective-C and React Native

Job Requirements:

Bachelor's / Master's in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent work experience
Fluency in Portuguese and English
Proven background in end-to-end application development, preferably in a commercial or consulting environment. 
Active contributions to open-source projects or technical communities are highly valued. 

Core attributes:

Solid foundation in software development practices, with a track record of developing robust, maintainable software. 
Involvement in the full software development lifecycle, from idea generation to deployment. 
Expertise in optimizing software and algorithms for maximum efficiency and performance. 
Adaptability in a dynamic, client-focused environment, with direct involvement in client interactions for feature development and product improvements. 
Passion for collaborative work, actively sharing and refining software design and solutions in a team setting. 
Intellectual curiosity and problem-solving skills across various industries and topics. 

Additional info

Please apply for the positions equivalent to your previous work experiences. The seniority will be evaluated according to your experience and career structure at BCG X during the process.

Even if you don‚Äôt meet all these requirements, we encourage you to apply if this job description excites you.

Note: For this position, we are considering applicants from S√£o Paulo and Rio de Janeiro, including both the capital cities and the surrounding areas within a 150km radius of the capitals.

Oportunidade: Senior Full Stack Engineer

Sobre a vaga
Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. As a consulting company, we often face the challenge of creating an engineering team in a matter of a week or two. To do that, we have created a secondary support business that runs a talent network and provides staffing services.

Our client is a healthcare-focused company that builds software designed to make the process of expediting healthcare plans and approving procedures in record time so that both patients and doctors can focus on what's more important - health.


The position

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a high-caliber software engineering team that is growing quickly. You will build impactful healthcare technology on a modern technology stack, by excelling in building new functionalities that support our client's teams to evolve product offerings and clinical intelligence.
It's a fully remote (of course!), full-time position for candidates either in Latin America, Africa, or Eastern Europe who can work on USA Eastern Time office hours (check what time it is in New York, for instance, and compare to your own to see what's the difference).


Responsibilities

Work on fast-paced, collaborative, agile teams to build and enhance a growing software platform together
Responsible for end-to-end feature releases and platform enhancements
Actively support the technical design process, bringing your expertise and analysis to help make data-driven decisions
Contribute heavily to feature design, development, testing, and delivery of our client's cloud platform and web applications
Support all parts of our client's platform from the database to the frontend
Continuously discover, understand, and implement new technologies & services to maximize development efficiency
Contribute to a culture committed to testing, quality, and attention to detail by supporting best practices such as writing and maintaining comprehensive test coverage
Actively participate in ensuring our client maintains a disciplined approach to healthcare security
Foster a community of mentorship for junior engineers on your team
 
Your background & requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
Experience working on software development teams, building and deploying full-stack web applications
Passionate about building quality products and want to own product development end-to-end, with excellent design and development standards
Collaborate closely with teammates in product and design to build applications providing healthcare practitioners with the highest quality user experience
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD
Team player, interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
A minimum of 7 full years of experience in the software development lifecycle
Experience with data pipelines or applications using Java or Groovy or Kotlin
Experience building applications using React (mandatory) and TypeScript (nice-to-have)
Hands-on experience leveraging test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest, Mocha, JUnit, or Cucumber
Hands-on experience building applications on NoSQL technologies
Hands-on in-depth experience building and maintaining services using either MongoDB or Elasticsearch or Kafka
You can start as soon as possible, ideally immediately
You are located in either Latin America, Africa, or Eastern Europe
You can work EST (Eastern Time) office hours


Nice to haves

Prior experience in healthcare and life sciences
Familiarity with healthcare interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR)
Experience with integration engines (like Mirth Connect, Mulesoft, etc.) for healthcare data exchange and transformation
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD (the team uses GitHub Actions)


Our recruitment process

Recruiter interview (30 min)
Technical interview (45 min)
Take-home coding exam (30 to 45 minutes, online, timed)
Hiring Manager (client) interview (30 min)
Design & development competency check interview (client) (about 45 minutes)
Final (client) interview (30 min)
 
We strive to move efficiently from step to step so that the recruitment process can be as fast as possible.

 What we offer

Totally remote, full-time (40h/week)
Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time office hours
Long-term, no end date independent contractor agreement
Payment in USD, biweekly or monthly - your choice
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Oportunidade: Senior Full Stack Engineer

Sobre a vaga
Virtasant is a leading cloud consulting services provider. We heavily focus on lift & shift, cloud-native development, cloud cost optimization, and migration services. As a consulting company, we often face the challenge of creating an engineering team in a matter of a week or two. To do that, we have created a secondary support business that runs a talent network and provides staffing services.

Our client is a healthcare-focused company that builds software designed to make the process of expediting healthcare plans and approving procedures in record time so that both patients and doctors can focus on what's more important - health.


The position

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a high-caliber software engineering team that is growing quickly. You will build impactful healthcare technology on a modern technology stack, by excelling in building new functionalities that support our client's teams to evolve product offerings and clinical intelligence.
It's a fully remote (of course!), full-time position for candidates either in Latin America, Africa, or Eastern Europe who can work on USA Eastern Time office hours (check what time it is in New York, for instance, and compare to your own to see what's the difference).


Responsibilities

Work on fast-paced, collaborative, agile teams to build and enhance a growing software platform together
Responsible for end-to-end feature releases and platform enhancements
Actively support the technical design process, bringing your expertise and analysis to help make data-driven decisions
Contribute heavily to feature design, development, testing, and delivery of our client's cloud platform and web applications
Support all parts of our client's platform from the database to the frontend
Continuously discover, understand, and implement new technologies & services to maximize development efficiency
Contribute to a culture committed to testing, quality, and attention to detail by supporting best practices such as writing and maintaining comprehensive test coverage
Actively participate in ensuring our client maintains a disciplined approach to healthcare security
Foster a community of mentorship for junior engineers on your team
 
Your background & requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
Experience working on software development teams, building and deploying full-stack web applications
Passionate about building quality products and want to own product development end-to-end, with excellent design and development standards
Collaborate closely with teammates in product and design to build applications providing healthcare practitioners with the highest quality user experience
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD
Team player, interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
A minimum of 7 full years of experience in the software development lifecycle
Experience with data pipelines or applications using Java or Groovy or Kotlin
Experience building applications using React (mandatory) and TypeScript (nice-to-have)
Hands-on experience leveraging test frameworks such as Cypress, Jest, Mocha, JUnit, or Cucumber
Hands-on experience building applications on NoSQL technologies
Hands-on in-depth experience building and maintaining services using either MongoDB or Elasticsearch or Kafka
You can start as soon as possible, ideally immediately
You are located in either Latin America, Africa, or Eastern Europe
You can work EST (Eastern Time) office hours


Nice to haves

Prior experience in healthcare and life sciences
Familiarity with healthcare interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR)
Experience with integration engines (like Mirth Connect, Mulesoft, etc.) for healthcare data exchange and transformation
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD (the team uses GitHub Actions)


Our recruitment process

Recruiter interview (30 min)
Technical interview (45 min)

Hiring Manager (client) interview (30 min)

Oportunidade: AI Engineer / Software Engineer with AI

Sobre a vaga
AI Engineer Who We Are

In 2021, Poatek was acquired by WillowTree, an award-winning digital product consultancy recognized as one of the fastest growing and best places to work in the United States. Now a TELUS International company , with offices across the globe, we continue to partner with the world‚Äôs leading brands, such as the FOX, Capital One, HBO, PepsiCo, Domino‚Äôs and more, to design, build, and transform their digital products and strategies. We‚Äôre looking to grow our Poatek offices in Brazil with top talent excited to collaborate with team members across the globe to deliver innovative solutions for our clients.

Location and Flexibility

This is a hybrid role. This model requires the ability to work in a hybrid mode from one of our offices in S√£o Paulo (2 times/ week or 8 days/ month) or Porto Alegre (3 times/ week or 12 days/ month). Our WFN culture is designed to foster in-person innovation, collaboration, and connection with team members local and visiting from other global offices.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a proficient AI Engineer passionate about turning AI research into tangible, effective solutions within our long-term client projects. As an AI Engineer, you will be instrumental in applying and integrating generative AI models to enhance digital products, making AI accessible and valuable in a real-world context.

Responsibilities

Apply your knowledge of software engineering and AI systems to develop AI solutions that directly address and resolve business problems.
Partner with Data Science professionals who specialize in machine learning and statistical modeling to address complex technical challenges, ensuring that the latest and most effective AI techniques are utilized.
Take ownership of implementing and optimizing applied AI components, ensuring they meet project needs with high complexity and scale.
Navigate and manipulate generative AI models, including large language models, to create prompts and solutions tailored to specific use cases.
Develop and incorporate AI solutions while adhering to industry best practices, including moderation, security, and compliance standards.
Lead the charge in designing, measuring, and evaluating AI model outputs, developing standard and custom metrics to ensure alignment with business objectives.
Translate AI research into production-ready features, delivering robust and scalable AI components that integrate seamlessly with larger systems.
Drive the selection and application of appropriate evaluation metrics, ensuring that AI solutions are robust, unbiased, and meet all necessary performance standards.

Qualifications

Demonstrable experience in applied AI, with a foundation in machine learning, deep learning, NLP, LLMs, and statistical analysis.
Strong understanding of the trade-offs between various generative AI models and the ability to choose the right model for specific use cases.
Experience with data embeddings and vector databases, understanding the trade-off between available options, and leveraging it to optimize data ingestion.
Experience building and testing a major server-side platform (such as TypeScript/Express, Java/Spring, Python/Django, C#/.NET, Ruby/Rails, etc) for API development and orchestration. 
Experience leveraging CI/CD tools such as AWS CodeDeploy, Azure Pipelines, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins.
Hands-on experience deploying software on leading cloud platforms and utilizing AI tools like AWS Bedrock and Azure AI Services.
Experience with performance optimization and observability platforms.
Proficiency in conducting experiment tracking and implementing complex AI integrations with minimal oversight.
Ability to communicate complex AI solutions and concepts effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Skilled in creating and adjusting prompts for complex AI systems to meet diverse project requirements.
Familiarity with testing and evaluating AI systems using state-of-the-art methods and best practices.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work alongside Data Science specialists, drawing on their expertise in AI model development and fine-tuning to deliver sophisticated AI solutions.

Why Poatek?

In addition to being part of an international and innovative consultancy company, you will have:

Flexible hours and autonomy
 Work with cutting edge technologies 
 Partner with global and relevant brands in the market 
 Collaborative team and learning ecosystem 
 Career development plan & growth 
 Internacional travel opportunities (optional) 

Some Of Our Benefits

 Health and dental plan 
 Life insurance 
 Monthly voucher for meals, culture, education, health and mobility 
 Child care assistance and more! 

Equality is a principle here at Poatek. We are committed to building an inclusive team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. Therefore we provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or disability.

We will only use the information you provide to process your application and to produce tracking statistics. Since we do not request personal data deemed sensitive, we ask you to abstain from sharing those information with us.

For more information on how we use your information, see our Privacy Policy.
